info.headline: Red Flag Warning issued December 25 at 3:39AM MST until December 25 at 5:00PM MST by NWS Pueblo
info.description: ...Red Flag Warning has been issued for 11 AM to 5 PM today for gusty winds, low relative humidity, and dry fuels for Fire Weather Zones 222, 226, 227, and 228, which includes El Paso, Pueblo, and Fremont Counties... ...Fire Weather Watch has been issued for Sunday late morning and Sunday afternoon for very strong winds, low relative humidity, and dry fuels for Fire Weather Zones 226 through 237, which includes El Paso, Pueblo, Huerfano, Las Animas, Crowley, Otero, Kiowa, Bent, Prowers, and Baca Counties... ...RED FLAG WARNING IN EFFECT FROM 11 AM THIS MORNING TO 5 PM MST THIS AFTERNOON FOR GUSTY WINDS, LOW RELATIVE HUMIDITY, AND DRY FUELS FOR FIRE WEATHER ZONE 228... ...FIRE WEATHER WATCH REMAINS IN EFFECT FROM SUNDAY MORNING THROUGH SUNDAY AFTERNOON FOR VERY STRONG WINDS, LOW RELATIVE HUMIDITY, AND DRY FUELS FOR FIRE WEATHER ZONE 228... The National Weather Service in Pueblo has issued a Red Flag Warning for gusty winds, low relative humidity, and dry fuels, which is in effect from 11 AM this morning to 5 PM MST this afternoon. * Affected Area...Fire Weather Zone 228. * Winds...For the Red Flag Warning, west-southwest 15 to 25 mph with gusts up to 35 mph. For the Fire Weather Watch, southwest 30 to 40 mph with gusts up to 65 mph. * Relative Humidity...For the Red Flag Warning and for the Fire Weather Watch, as low as 15 percent. * Impacts...Conditions will be favorable for rapid rates of fire growth and spread.
info.instruction: A Red Flag Warning means that critical fire weather conditions are either occurring now, or will shortly. A combination of strong winds, low relative humidity, and warm temperatures can contribute to extreme fire behavior. A Fire Weather Watch means that critical fire weather conditions are forecast to occur. Listen for later forecasts and possible Red Flag Warnings.
